4.text: Every now and then it's good to get some fresh air.

6.text: Whether to the woods or the beach.

8.text:
Get amongst the trees and run around
carefree,

10.text: but there's one thing I think you're going to need.

12.text: Plant your feet in the great outdoors.

14.text: The day is new and clear so

17.text: go in search of the mighty stick.  Earth's unlikely hero.

20.text:
Imagination, patience, and an appetite for
fun. Climbing favourite trees.

24.text: You can find the perfect one.

26.text: Pick one from the ground.  It's yours now and you can keep it.

28.text: A stick can be whatever.  Really that's the secret.

31.text: Use your imagination, customise the world you see.

34.text:
Mud pies are quite nice when garnished
with a leaf. but don't eat it.

37.text: They can be drumsticks, or a xylophone, or a trombone, or a microphone.

40.text: A magic wand or a dragon bone.

42.text: A witch's broom or wizard's phone?

44.text: A baton or a hurdle or a javelin or a bow. Yep!

48.text: Sticks can keep you active if you use them with some gusto.

50.text: With a stick you're never bored because it's a feather and a sword.

53.text: You can slay any beast or just tickle it and tame it.

56.text: Be Picasso, Frida Kahlo.  Paint with nature and then frame it.

59.text: A stick can be a paint brush or a pencil or a pen.

62.text: While a single stick is fun, a stack of sticks can make a den.

65.text: Or you can make a secret plan to form a superhero team.

68.text:
And force your brand of justice in the
woods or by the stream.

74.text:
the thing about a stick it's the gift that
keeps on giving,

76.text: because anything is possible.  And that's the joy of living.

79.text: So go and start your story.  Search the land and take a stamp.

82.text: Because when you hold the simple stick there's adventure in your hand.
